OCD.name: STS Ldap and Roles Claims Handler Configuration

AD.name: LDAP URL:
AD.description: LDAP or LDAPS server and port

AD.name: LDAP Bind User DN:
AD.description: DN of the user to bind with LDAP. This user should have the ability to verify passwords and read attributes for any user.

AD.name: LDAP Bind User Password:
AD.description: Password used to bind user with LDAP.

AD.name: LDAP Username Attribute:
AD.description: Attribute used to designate the user's name in LDAP. Usually this is uid, cn, or something similar.

AD.name: LDAP Base User DN:
AD.description: Full LDAP path to where users can be found.

AD.name: LDAP Base Group DN:
AD.description: Full LDAP path to where groups can be found.

AD.name: User Attribute Map:
AD.default: http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/nameidentifier=uid, http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/emailaddress=mail, http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/surname=sn, http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/givenname=givenName, http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/role=role, AdminOrganization=organizationName, AuthorityCategory=poa, ATOStatus=organizationalStatus, AICP=cleared, Clearance=clearance, CountryOfAffiliation=countryOfAffiliation, DigitalIdentifier=ds-certificate-subject-dn, DutyOrganization=extendedGroup, EntityType=employeeType, isICMember=cleared, FineAccessControls=SCIControls, Role=extendedFunctionalRole, Region=geographicSubRegion, LifeCycleStatus=citizenshipStatus, Topic=nipfTopic
AD.description: Map used to determine the claims (attributes) to role (group) mapping of a user in LDAP. One attribute must map to the Security Claim Type.
